law.catch_line: A court may not grant injunctive relief in a labor dispute:...

text.section:
A court may not grant injunctive relief in a labor dispute:
if the plaintiff has failed to comply with each obligation imposed by law that is involved in the labor dispute; or
except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, if the plaintiff has failed to make every reasonable effort to settle the labor dispute:
by negotiation; or
with the help of available dispute resolution mechanisms, governmental mediation, or voluntary arbitration.
If irreparable injury is threatened, a court may grant injunctive relief before another tribunal acts to settle the labor dispute.
